Dialogue: And you believed her?  I even went down to the campus  police and made out a report about her.

Speaker: catherine
Dialogue: You still think I kill people, don't you?

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: No.

Speaker: catherine
Dialogue: Liar.

Speaker: campus cop
Dialogue: Who'd you say you were with?

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: Homicide.  San Francisco.

Speaker: campus cop
Dialogue: Don't you guys communicate over there?  You must be the same way we are.

Speaker: campus cop
Dialogue: There was a report about Lisa Henderson -- January, 1977 -- the file's not here.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: What do you mean it's not here?

Speaker: campus cop
Dialogue: San Francisco P.D. Detective Nilsen. Internal Affairs.  You know him? Tell him we want it back.  He's had it a whole year.

Speaker: gus
Dialogue: So Nilsen had a report on her -- so what.  You don't know what the hell was in it?

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: Catherine told me what was in it.

Speaker: gus
Dialogue: If she's telling  you the truth.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: Don't you get it, Gus?  If Beth killed Johnny Boz to frame Catherine -- she wouldn't want anyone to know what happened at Berkeley.  It gives her the motive to kill Nilsen.

Speaker: gus
Dialogue: How did she know Nilsen knew about it -- if it happened?

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: He was I.A.  He probably asked her about it.

Speaker: gus
Dialogue: She'd have to be nuttier than a twenty-pound Christmas fruitcake. She's not the one who hangs out with multiple murderers -- your girlfriend is.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: She's a writer -- it's part of what she does.

Speaker: gus
Dialogue: There's gotta be somebody at Berkeley who knows what the hell happened.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: I know what happened.  Catherine told me what happened.

Speaker: gus
Dialogue: You got goddamn tweety-birds flutterin' around your head, that's what you got.  You think you're gonna fuck like minks, raise rugrats, and live happily ever after?  Oh, man.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: How'd you get in here?

Speaker: catherine
Dialogue: I decided to give you one more chance.  I missed you.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: You didn't not see me long enough to miss me.

Speaker: catherine
Dialogue: Did you miss me?

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: No.

Speaker: catherine
Dialogue: Come over here and tell me no.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: No.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: That's below the belt.

Speaker: catherine
Dialogue: Not yet it isn't.

Speaker: catherine
Dialogue: But we're getting there.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: I have to do some research tomorrow.

Speaker: catherine
Dialogue: I'm very good at research.  I'll help you.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: No thanks.

Speaker: catherine
Dialogue: What are you researching?

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: I'm writing a book.

Speaker: catherine
Dialogue: Really.  What are you writing about.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: A detective.  He falls for the wrong girl.

Speaker: catherine
Dialogue: What happens to them?

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: They fuck like minks, raise rugrats, and live happily ever after.

Speaker: catherine
Dialogue: It won't sell.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: Why not?

Speaker: catherine
Dialogue: Somebody has to die.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: Why?

Speaker: catherine
Dialogue: Somebody always does.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: Hi, I'm looking for a Dr. Gardner?

Speaker: one woman
Dialogue: We don't have a Dr. Gardner on staff here.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: Yeah.

Speaker: the woman
Dialogue: He died -- about five or six years ago.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: He was shot.

Speaker: detective
Dialogue: He was walking home from work. They only lived a coupla blocks from the clinic.  Somebody drove by and shot him.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: What was the weapon?

Speaker: detective
Dialogue: .38 revolver.  Never recovered.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: Were there ever any suspects?

Speaker: detective
Dialogue: No suspects, no motive.  Unsolved.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: Was his wife ever a suspect?

Speaker: detective
Dialogue: I had another one of you guys down here from Frisco -- about a year ago -- he asked me the same question.  What's this about anyway?

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: Routine.

Speaker: detective
Dialogue: Yeah, he said it was routine too. Now it's two guys saying it's routine.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: Do you remember his name?

Speaker: detective
Dialogue: Nope, can't say that I do.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: Nilsen?

Speaker: detective
Dialogue: That's him.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: Was she ever a suspect?

Speaker: detective
Dialogue: Nope.  There was some talk; it never panned.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: What kind of talk?

Speaker: detective
Dialogue: The usual -- a girlfriend.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: He had a girlfriend?

Speaker: detective
Dialogue: Nope. She did.  Like I say.  It never panned.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: Thanks.

Speaker: detective
Dialogue: I hope I helped you out.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: You did.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: Hi.  I missed you.  I finished my research.

Speaker: catherine
Dialogue: I finished my book.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: How did it end?

Speaker: catherine
Dialogue: I told you.  She kills him.

Speaker: catherine
Dialogue: Goodbye, Nick.

Speaker: catherine
Dialogue: I finished my book.  Goodbye.

Speaker: catherine
Dialogue: What do you want, Nick?  Flowers? I'll send you some flowers.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: Are we playing games again?

Speaker: catherine
Dialogue: The games are over.  You were right. It was the fuck of the century, Shooter.

Speaker: catherine
Dialogue: Right there.

Speaker: gus
Dialogue: Catherine Tramell's roommate her freshman year.  I got a call from her.  I've been calling people who were in her dorm all day.  She must've heard I was trying to talk to her.  She says she knows all about Catherine and Lisa Henderson. She's over in Oakland.  You wanna come with me?

Speaker: gus
Dialogue: You look like you seen a ghost, son?

Speaker: gus
Dialogue: Johnny Boz's psychiatrist has an office on Van Ness.  Guess who he shares office space with?  Dr. Elizabeth Gardner.

Speaker: gus
Dialogue: What in hell's the matter with you?

Speaker: gus
Dialogue: Where the hell you goin'?

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: I'm going with you.

Speaker: gus
Dialogue: She said alone -- suite 405.  It ain't gonna take long.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: Gus!

Speaker: beth
Dialogue: What are you doing here?

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: Put your hands up!

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: Put your fucking hands up!  Don't move.

Speaker: beth
Dialogue: I got a message on my machine to meet Gus here.  Where is he?

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: I know about your husband.  You still like girls, Beth?

Speaker: beth
Dialogue: What?

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: Take your hands out of your pockets!

Speaker: beth
Dialogue: What is wrong with you?

Speaker: beth
Dialogue: I loved you.

Speaker: andrews
Dialogue: Lieutenant.

Speaker: andrews
Dialogue: Thirty-eight caliber revolver.

Speaker: harrigan
Dialogue: Lieutenant, you'd better come in here.

Speaker: detective
Dialogue: There was no suite 405 in that building.  Catherine Tramell's roommate in her freshman year is dead.  She died of leukemia two years ago.

Speaker: andrews
Dialogue: Thanks.

Speaker: andrews
Dialogue: Ballistics says the .38 we found in her apartment matches Nilsen. No registration.  They're checking with Salinas.  The icepick is the same brand and model as the Boz weapon.

Speaker: harrigan
Dialogue: We checked the tape machines at Dr.  Gardner's apartment and at her office -- both here and the one on Van Ness.  No message from Gus on any of 'em.  The one at her apartment was broken.  Johnny Boz's psychiatrist says he thinks he remembers Dr. Gardner and Boz meeting at a Christmas party at his house a year ago.

Speaker: captain talcott
Dialogue: Congratulations, Curran.

Speaker: a voice
Dialogue: Hi.

Speaker: catherine
Dialogue: I heard about it... on TV.

Speaker: catherine
Dialogue: I can't allow myself to care about you -- I can't allow myself to care -- I can't -- I can't --

Speaker: catherine
Dialogue: I don't want to do this -- please -- I don't want to do this -- I lose everybody -- I don't want to lose you -- I don't want to --

Speaker: catherine
Dialogue: What do we do now, Nick?

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: We fuck like minks.  We raise rugrats.  We live happily ever after.

Speaker: catherine
Dialogue: I hate rugrats.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: We fuck like minks.  We forget the rugrats.  We live happily ever after.

Speaker: catherine
Dialogue: I love you.
